155221134241.content:
Along with the commander, Jack returned back to Skull island having appointed himself as guide for the group.

With the two of them, almost fifty soldiers were coming, each armed to the teeth, and yet Jack knew it was pointless. Mankind couldn’t fight with the creatures living in that place. They could only flee and avoid them as much as they could. Still, he kept the façade, he made sure of being overheard when the commander made foolish decision, so that the crew would know who was to blame in the end.

As they reached the coast, immediately they began moving deeper inside the island, luckily for Jack, the explorers had previously thought of making camp somewhat near the tribal village, so he hadn’t had much to do to ensure that they proceeded in the right direction. Although, as noisy as the soldiers were, that very first night their rescue team lost three men to some kind of bird of prey. Jack had tried to have the commander understand that they needed to split their team in smaller groups and to stay hidden into caves, avoiding the open grounds but, the man didn’t want to hear it from a simple civilian.

Jack, naturally, wouldn’t stress too much about these points, after all, it all worked in his advantage.

In the following week, from the fifty-two people who had come out of the warship, less than thirty were still alive and present. All the others had been either devoured or vanished within deep caves. As fatalities kept increasing, so the commander authority vanished, and yet, Jack waited.

They were close to the tribal village, and he didn’t want to risk everything he had worked for without having the absolute certainty that his leadership was not going to be contested. In his plans, he could make it with a dozen of men so, he could afford to wait a bit more.

As nights passed, Jack noticed that two thirds of the rescue team were now following his lead, blindly. As he talked to them, one night, he realized that they were ready.

Having their faith lying within him, they followed him, as he told them that they could easily escape the island, they only needed a special kind of hostage to safeguard them against the most dangerous monster in that place. By sheer luck, or misfortune, they had never had any encounter with the massively monstrous ape and yet, the marines and the second in command, trusted him blindly.

If he had said jump, they would have all jumped down a cliff.

As Jack moved his own group toward the village, going for a passage he had found as he had been tracking Ann, he realized that he would have been the same if someone had come to him when he had been on the island on his first few weeks.

They were so scared that they weren’t thinking at all.

Jack could use this to his advantage.

Leaving their commander behind, escaping into the night, Jack and his men moved swiftly through the night, until they reached the passage he had found by chance. The cave was dark and deep. One false step would lie to doom but, by following the right path Jack could lead his team right behind the village, on a grassy hilltop that they were going to use to install the ropes needed for the elevator to be placed. As he looked down from the hilltop, at the sea below, he could see the faint outline of the barge, having been moved there with lots of effort from the crew still aboard the warship.

Taking their time, they placed the elevator and verified that it was working. As he was the one offering to test it, he managed to breach the news on board that their original commander was dead and that he and his team of ‘survivors’ were going to take something from the Island, something that would bring the most dangerous beast there unable to harm them.

At this point, a few of the seamen still on the warship began to wonder how Mr. Driscoll could have foreseen the need to have that platform ready if he hadn’t planned of leaving from that specific place but, they were soon quieted by their comrades, as these acted more like fanatics than marines anymore.

As Jack returned to the hilltop, he began relaying his orders. Of the people following him, a dozen or so were going to assault the village, killing anything that came in their way, making sure that the natives weren’t going to be a threat. He and the remaining eight man were going to take care of moving their soon to be hostage from the elevated construction with any mean necessary.

That same night, twenty deadly shadows began moving within the village, each was ready to unleash an inferno of bullets and grenades on the natives which, feeling confident behind their wall had never had nothing to fear from behind of it. The few sentries that were around were quickly silenced, permitting Jack to advance cautiously until he was on the construction were Ann was being held hostage. As he slowly walked toward her, he couldn’t believe how magnificently big she had managed to grow herself into.

As he stepped closer and closer, he lifted his hand until he could touch her flabby skin, feeling it exceedingly warm at his touch. As he roamed his hands on what was really just one of many, massive, belly rolls, he couldn’t stop fondling it, squishing it within his grasp. He started to get so much into it that he even thought of hearing her moan from his fondling. Yet, he shook himself. He had no time to waste as of now, he couldn’t afford to lose everything now the he was so close to have everything he had wanted.

Letting the pile of flab go, he began climbing her body, seeing that his estimates hadn’t been far from being right. In those two weeks she had managed to grow even fatter than before, becoming an immobile mass of flab, a humongous, jiggly, mountain unable to move or cater for herself. As he kept climbing on her belly, almost getting his leg stuck into her navel, he finally managed to reach the valley between her breasts. Pushing forward he advanced on that unexplored territory, promising himself to delve deeper in exploration of that amazing body, as soon as they were safe, until he reached her head.

There he stood, once more, speechless. Surrounded by a ring of at least seven chins, her head was gently placed against her backfat, using it as a pillow to help her sleep. As he moved closer he could see that her beautiful face had been distorted by all the fat coursing through it and yet, although her cheeks looked puffy and swollen, as they cascaded down toward her multiple chins, in his eyes, she remained the most wonderful woman he had ever seen.

Now, more than ever.

Waking up from his reverie he moved closer to her face, as he woke her up gently.

“Ann? Ann, wake up?”

“Hmm…? Kaak…is that… you…?”

As she slowly opened her eyes, she saw a face extremely close to hers, it was a face she knew, she was most certain of it, but who it was? As she completely woke up, she realized immediately who was the man standing over her.

“… Jack…? Is it… really… you?”

“Yeah… That’s me, Ann. I promised you to see you back to safety, didn’t I? I’ve finally arranged a way to bring you home.”

It was then that Ann Darrow, former actress, thought back to her life in the continent, she truly was going to be back to her life, back to her parties and to perform into movies. She was so happy that she tried to hug Jack but, due to her size, found herself unable to.

“Heh…guess… I’ve… gained… a pound… or two… since… coming… here…”

“No way, Ann…you’re perfect the way you are.
Now, we need to be as quick as possible. My men are going to have you move on a few rolling trunks, it won’t be pleasant but, we can’t risk you overworking yourself, can’t we?”

“Your… men…? What… are… you… talking… about…?”

“Shh, be quiet for a moment, dear. We’re in the middle of the village, this will turn into a bloodbath if they see us here. Don’t you worry love, soon you’ll be back with me in the States.

We will marry and we will be so happy together…”

Slowly, Jack and his team worked tirelessly as they helped the billowing mass of fat that Ann Darrow had become, moving her toward the hilltop. A few of the men began wondering why they were taking that massive, hulking, jelly-like behemoth with them but, since it was orders from Jack, none of them argued.

He knew best on this island.

As they finally made it atop the hill, he quickly kissed Ann on the cheek, before leaving her to speak with his men.

“Listen up, guys. Raze this place to the ground, loot whatever you want and bring back as much treasure as you can. I’ll start bringing ‘That’ on the barge and send you guys the elevator platform back. By the time the platform is back here, I want you to run for it and we will take you down.

One more thing, currents in this place are treacherous and capable of sinking ships bigger than this one. If you reach the elevator and you see us moving, do not panic. We will reconvene at the beach.

Get there safely, as I taught you, and you will be back unharmed.

Now, go get it, lads!”

Having released his men, Jack moved back toward the platform, letting it transport him and his soon-to-be bride toward the cargo barge down below. When they finally were on the barge, with Ann securely strapped on the main deck, Jack quickly ordered to cut the ropes and move back toward the continent.

When the Chief Engineer, left in command of the vessel, inquired about their companions, all Jack answered was with “They’re all dead. They didn’t heed my advices when I gave them.”

Still trusting the man in front of them, the warship and the barge crews, began to move out from the island, while Jack looked back at the island, feeling as if he had just paid a deed with the Devil, exchanging fifty lives with the life of one woman.

1552211342412.content:
Sarah Gold had been an explorer for most of her life, since she was just a kid when she traveled with her father along the US. But, when the occasion arrived on her desk, to be the first woman to explore a previously unknown island, she didn’t even think about refusing. She immediately accepted and prepared herself.

Alas, she had thought of being sent there with people of her caliber, people who knew how to live in the wilderness. Instead, the team she was going with was mostly composed by scientists, geologist, and many more -ists she wanted to remember. Still, she was feeling energized.

A new land where, supposedly, no man had walked before.

It took them a couple of months to travel from New York to this new island.

As per request from their expedition leader, they were going to be staying on the island for no more than two weeks, then they would have reconvened on the shore and signaled to the warship escorting them to come and pick them up to return home. In those two weeks, they were going to find a place suited to be turned into an expedition base, that was going to be built by workers from the main land as soon as the place was deemed secure, and worthy, by their expedition. Along with them, for security reason, a small platoon of soldiers was going to be deployed with them, although the Leader was sure that it was just a needless precaution.

ONE WEEK LATER

Sarah was hiding silently on the branches of a tree, her hands tightly placed against her mouth as she replayed in silent horror to the massacre that she had witnessed with her own eyes. Everything had seemed to be going well, the flora on that island was different from any other in any country Sarah had ever seen. But, as they ventured deep within the jungle, not one of the expedition team had been able to see a single example of fauna. There were insects, sometimes reaching sizes similar to that of a small dog, but no other animal.

Sarah found it eerie. How could this place keep its balance without any kind of predator?

But, as the team made their base camp on the edge of the jungle, in one night all hell broke loose.

It all started just as Sarah was leaving the mess hall tent, slowly walking toward her own sleeping bag. In front of her eyes, she saw one of the sentries suddenly being grabbed by something and brought into the deepest part of the jungle. After that sight, before she could utter a warning, screams and shouts began to be rung throughout the camp. Twirling around she saw creatures, monsters, emerging from the jungle, assaulting rapidly the camp, grabbing someone and running swiftly back into the forest.

In front of her, she saw one girl, Alexia Shu, she recalled, which was the paleontologist of the team. Sarah saw her, turning toward her with a smile plastered on her face, as if she couldn’t be happier of what she had just seen.

“Raptors, Sarah! These are Raptors! They were supposed to be …”

Before she could finish, though, something massive emerged from the jungle, closing its massive jaws on her, cutting her words in half as they changed into a long, pain filled, shriek. As the thing snapped its jaws on the girl, blood splattered all over, covering Sarah who, paralyzed by fear could only watch around herself as the carnage continued.

As another man was quickly thrown to the ground by one of those raptors that Alexia had been so amazed about, Sarah returned into herself and began running away from the massacre. Jumping into the jungle, motivated by fear, she began to run and run until the screams were nothing but a whisper in the wind. As she found herself, alone, in that jungle, she quickly scanned the vegetation around her and did the only sensible thing she could think of.

She climbed the tallest tree she could find.

For two days she stayed up there, too afraid of getting down from the tree, even though she was desperately in need of water and food. Yet, she felt like her muscles had turned into lead ingots, welded around the trunk of the tree on which she had been taking refuge.

From up there, in the past day, she had been able to see them.

The fauna of the island.

They had passed right in the midst of them, or, in some cases, even under some of the biggest ones, and yet as they were probably unknown in that habitat those predators had shown caution towards them. But, when they had found them in their camp, completely unguarded, they had attacked.

As days passed, Sarah began to venture little by little into the jungle, foraging just the smallest amount she needed to survive, still too afraid to leave her only safe place. Day by day she climbed that tree, up and down, collecting a mouthful of berries and a few sips of water from a nearby river. But at the lightest sound, she would quickly return to her tree, hiding up there, in the safety of the tallest branches, waiting for the sun to set and rise again.

For a short month she managed to keep on living although, her body was swiftly drying its own resources fast. That day, as the sun was high, she hadn’t felt strong enough to climb down and so she slept but, as night came, she found she couldn’t move from her hiding spot.

Too paralyzed to go around in the night, no matter how hungry or thirsty she felt.

As the night progressed, she saw a massive tiger like beast circling around her tree, probably attracted by the dried blood all over her. Yet, the beast wasn’t able, probably, to climb up to her. Yet it waited under it.

And she knew that she couldn’t have lasted another full day without water or food in her.

‘I’m doomed. I can’t escape that thing, weak as I am…

Should I have stayed at the camp?

Should I have given up, there, thus quickly ending my life as all the others?

What good has been for me to survive one more week like this? Why should I keep enduring this pain?’

Suddenly, though, the ground began to tremble, and she saw the silhouette of the beast fleeing into the dense jungle, as if scared by something. Yet, the ground kept on shaking, as if something truly massive walked on it with huge feet. Tiredly, Sarah began to look around once more, searching for that tallest mountain she had seen on the horizon, dreaming of being up there, at least for one time, to see all the island in its beautiful, and deadly, purity. But as she turned toward the horizon, where she knew that the mountain was, she saw only darkness.

‘No? It’s not darkness…something is standing here, shadowing the entire horizon?’

Looking up, she blanched as she saw one massive eye peering down to her, looking at her as she gripped even more tightly on the tree trunk, paralyzed by fear.


Kong had been restless all night long.

Something seemed to be telling him to be on alert, and yet, nothing could threaten him on His territory. Still, as he woke up, he looked to the spot where Ann, his friend had once been. Now, he had given her to the other creatures like her, so that they could help her grow big and strong, until she could become his perfect partner.

Restless as he was, he grunted a bit as he rose and began to descend the mountain, deciding to go around his territory and, maybe hunt something for Ann.

As he was moving about, he noticed one of the small beasties that he had already used once to provide warm meat to his Ann. Yet, something was curious about that animal. It was circling a tree so, he reasoned, there had to be something tasty on that tree. Moving closer made the little beast run away cowering in fear but, there was something decidedly wrong on that tree.

Kong smelled blood coming from its highest point.

Moving closer he peered within it, curious as to why blood was on a tree but, as he looked closely, he saw one of those tiny little creatures just like his Ann. The creature was gripping the tree with all of its might but, since Kong didn’t want to hurt it he didn’t dare move his hand toward it. Unsure about the situation, but recalling what Ann had ‘told him’ once, he crouched and simply ripped the tree from the ground, having care in not letting the creature on it to fall.

Ann had told him that while other creatures like her could hurt him, they would mostly do it for fear. If he tried to be kind toward them, maybe he could have more friends.
With those ‘words’ in his mind, Kong began to climb back atop of his mountain, wanting to show his kindness to another creature as Ann had told him to.

Jack had made it.

He had managed to save Ann from that horrible beast and from that Hellish island. Now, with her under his wing, Jack could finally feel complete. Still, sometimes, he could hear the Voices snickering around him but, with Ann by his side he felt like nothing could ever bring him down.

Alas, he had to admit that Ann seemed rather worried about her returning home and, most worryingly, about that awful monster. Still, he had been trying to act charming to get her to forget that thing and, at first, it had seemed to be working but, yet she kept bringing up that wretched thing within their discussions.

Jack was losing his patience and, at first, he had been toying with the idea of cutting her out of food, so to let her learn her place. But as he thought about it he realized that there was a better way.

It was true that under that monster she had been growing massively but, for sure, he could provide her with tastier food than the one she could have eaten on that accursed island. All he had to do was to keep the tasty food coming her way, until she would either, forget about the monster or focus only on the food.

Either way, Jack was going to be a happy man.

Initially, he placed the plan in motion, but not even a short week later he realized there was a major flaw in his plan. The trip to return home was going to take a couple of months while, giving all the food to Ann would deplete their reserves in less than three weeks. Jack knew that something had to be done.

He had to manage to erase from her mouth the name of ‘Kong’ but to do that he was going to need much more food that he could afford. As he looked around, he noticed that some of the crew members were looking rather…plump. If he could get them to grow a bit more, he could not only restock the larder but, also, reduce the number of mouths to be fed.

As a manic glint filled his eyes, Jack began to spend much more time with the crew members, talking with them, getting to know them and to better visualize which were the easiest targets around. Also, he brought forth the continuation of his plan to keep on being the leader for those who were with him on the ship. Day by day, he began to act more like a father to them, starting to teach them a distorted version of the bible.
With this trick, since already he had their loyalties, he was sure that nothing would prevent him to reach the mainland with Ann, even if he had to be the only other survivor beside her.


Thomas Denfort had been recruited on the warship as a dishwasher.

He was ‘trained’ to be a marine but, most of his time he usually spent working in the kitchen, cleaning and bringing food to the officers. Although trained, he wasn’t battle ready at all, it was enough to look at him to realize that he wasn’t going to be a soldier any sooner. As most of his family he was ‘big boned’ and adding to that, he still managed to sneak treats and snacks every now and then, making himself quite portly.

Still, he did his duty as any other marine did but, their leader, the once civilian, Mr. Driscoll said to have seen something in him and so wanted him and a few other boys to be moved from their current position to be placed under a new work of some kind. Thomas, at first, was kind sorry of leaving the kitchens, but as he saw what his new job consisted of, he could only be happy for it.

All Thomas had to do in this new job of his was to sit around all day long and ‘taste’ some of the food that other members of the crew would bring to him. Father Driscoll, as most of the crews had started to call Jack, had told all of them one night that they had to take examples from the teachings of the Book, give and you will receive and all that sort of crap.

Thomas wasn’t really believing all those things but, if by playing along he managed to laze around all day while stuffing his gut, he was more than pleased.

Jack little ‘farm’ was coming along nicely.

The ten guys he had selected were growing steadily, as they were being fattened without even realizing what was going to happen to them. But it was going to be soon, so Jack had used most of his influence to convert them, especially on the cooks.

For it was them that were going to be central for his plan to reach completion.

It was now a month since they had left the Island and Jack could see that his little farm had grown enough. It was also true that, between the farm and Ann’s consumption their stocks were largely dwindling down to nothingness. Still, Jack, wasn’t too worried about that. With the food they were going to recover from his little farm, he already had planned a second series of people that was going to be working for the good of them all.

The selected guys were so faithful toward him that he hadn’t even needed to select them. They offered themselves as soon as they had heard that those that had been there before them, had ascended to greater heights.

Jack, and the restricted few who had been made aware of the truth, could scarcely believe it but, it was too good an opportunity to let it dwindle to nothing. But, of all the people present in the current farm, Thomas was chosen by Jack for a special assignment.

As Jack, and a couple of helpers, assisted Thomas as he waddled through the ship, he slowly brought him on the cargo barge below deck. There, he gave his permission to Thomas to rest a bit on one of the benches, which creaked ominously under the massive weight of the once marine. In those weeks of lazing around, doing nothing but eating, Thomas Denfort had grown massive indeed. Used to eat his fair amount, his stomach had been brought to his limits as Jack requested him to have more than any other of his farm.

The guy had blindly enjoyed his good fortune, without noticing that as each day passed, he was still being stuffed full of anything edible. He had noticed that moving around, or even the simple act of standing up, had become way harder to do than he remembered but, Father Driscoll had always been at his side, easing his worries, calming him and telling him that nothing was wrong with how he felt about his body.
Until that fateful day, when the Father and a few of his helpers had brought him on the below decks of the barge.

“Er…Father… wh-why are we… here? I thought… that the… Goddess… had to be… left… alone?”

“Oh, my young Thomas. The day has come. The moment of your ascension has arrived. You should be filled with joy for you’re going to be saved.”

“Wh…*urp*… What?”

“Brothers? Prepare him…”

Swiftly, Jack’s aides grabbed the young, fattened, man and forced an apple into his mouth, shutting him up as they quickly tied both his hands and legs. Then, once he was silenced, they coated his skin with a thick strata of bacon grease. Once he was prepared and unable to move any inch of his five-hundred-pound frame, he was taken and slowly moved toward the upper decks where Ann had been securely strapped when fleeing from the Island.

Jack, who had kept his Ann well fed in that month, began climbing her body, finally reaching her face.

“Ann? Ann, I’ve got a surprise for you…”

“What…what is it? Is it…Food? So…Hungry…”

“Yes, Ann, dear. It’s food for you. But I want this to be a surprise, so, I’ll tie this handkerchief over your eyes… No peeking, my dear.”

As he obstructed her vision, he motioned to his aides to bring forward Thomas as they all began then to place him right in line towards Ann’s mouth.

“Now, Ann, you remember how I’ve taught to you to just open your mouth wider than usual?”

“Y-Yes? Jack… What… what is… going… on…?”

“Trust in me, Ann. It’s just a morsel a tad bigger than usual but, I’m sure you will enjoy it. Open wide now, yes, a little bit wider still…”


Ann wasn’t sure what was going on. Since Jack had ‘rescued’ her from Skull Island she had passed the longest period she could remember eating barely enough to fend off the feeling of starvation within herself. Also, although he seemed rather affectionate toward her, he kept repeating strange things when he thought of being alone, murmuring his name, over and over. Then, two weeks before he had started to feed her bigger and bigger things, asking her to try and swallow them in one go. It had been hard but, she managed, hoping to make him happy but, all he seemed to become was only more sinister.

Still, she was growing hungrier and hungrier and so she could do nothing but to do as Jack said. Although, especially in these moments, she thought back to her friend Kong who had provided her too but, with true passion and friendship.

As she opened her mouth at her widest, she suddenly felt something being shoved into it. Taken by surprise she tried her hardest to not snap her jaw, since Jack could become rather aggressive if she didn’t do what he wanted, instead she tried to swallow, using her tongue to ease the passage of, whatever that thing was.

But, as her tongue passed on that thing, her eyes opened wide in shock as, whatever that was, it tasted amazing. Helped also by Jack and his aides, she began, finally to swallow it, feeling its massive weight as it passed from her mouth into her throat, ending finally with a loud sound into the pit of her stomach.

Ann had never tasted anything so delicious and yet so filling.

As Jack removed the cover from her eyes, she looked at him, feeling pleasantly surprised by him for the first time in a long time. And yet, although feeling contently full, she could see that something was wrong in his eyes. He was looking at her rather strangely but, she thought, that it was probably nothing but the light.

Jack instead, was cackling in his cabin.

The trip was almost over, the following morning the warship was due to arrive near the port of New York and, most importantly, a small part of their larder was still intact, while alas the crew members had sadly reduced to a skeleton crew. All those that still were on board were the most loyal and faithful, the one who basically took anything that Jack said as an incontrovertible truth.

And, also important from Jack’s view, they were all fat.

Jack had made sure to use almost any scraps, except a few rations for himself, giving it all to the remaining crew members, making sure that each spent most of his day eating and resting. This now left him with five people who had been fattening along nicely and two being his prized piggies. To be sure that nobody would say something against him, Jack had already planned everything. Before the sun was rising, there were going to be only two people on board of the warship.

Him and Ann.

Surprisingly, the night before, she had confessed to him that she was getting addicted to those ‘treats’ he was giving to her and so, he was now wondering if today was going to be the day where he would tell her the truth. Before doing that, though, he had to get rid of the less faithful of his servants.

Specifically, of those pesky five guys who hadn’t manage to turn themselves in veritable balls of food and fat. To do that, already he had made pacts with a few of them, he was going to bring a couple of them to Ann, and then use one of the two to help him feed the other to her. Then, he would simply repeat the process with the new guy that was going to arrive.

With those dark thoughts in mind, Jack began cackling, only to stop after a little bit, looking nervously around himself. Gaining control over his emotion he prepared to start a feast that his Ann wasn’t going to forget. Inviting the first two to meet him at the Goddess was pretty easy, although he had to admit that restraining the first of them was rather harder than he had thought. Still, with these guys weight ranging from one hundred eighty to the three hundred pounds, they sure were the light weights of his flock.

Yet, one by one, as he tricked the last one by using the new arrival against him, he managed to stuff pretty quickly four guys into Ann’s gullet, much to her pleasure.
Knocking down the fifth guy was particularly hard but, after a bit of a fight with him, Jack finally managed to render him unconscious. After having restrained him and undressed him, Jack Driscoll began the hard part.

To move him from the main deck, toward the gaping maw of Miss Ann Darrow. Still, somehow, he managed and Ann, which had by now become a champion in eating those ‘treats’, didn’t even need any help in sending it down.

“Are you full, my dear?”

“*Oaarp*… Ugh…they were… a bit… filling, Jack. But… if you’ve got… more… of those…you know… I can’t… say no…they’re… just… too… good.”

“Oh, Baby. You ain’t seen nothing yet. I’ve reserved the best for the last.”

Leaving his immense woman, Jack climbed down and was met with the last two members of his flock.

The first one was Joshua Graham, in those last weeks he had done nothing but stuffing himself, eating as much as he could, even managing to steal food from his colleagues. Joshua, who had started the trip weighing roughly two hundred pounds already, had managed the impressive feat of reaching five hundred and thirty-five pounds. Still, he was nothing if compared with his companion.

As big as Joshua was, the blue ribbon, if Jack could give one, had to be given to his friend, Abe Klintock.

Abe, one of the last scullery boys on the ship had been a scrawny little thing when Jack recruited him for the next ascension, weighing in at a measly one hundred and fifty pounds and yet, since he wasn’t white, he managed to reach a total weight of five hundred ninety-six pounds of weight. Jack had imagined that ‘little’ Abe would have reacted like that, being able to show off his skills to all the other white guys around, making them see how the different and, often, tormented little one had managed to grow biggest than them all.

“Abe, Joshua, a pleasure to see you guys.”

“We…*huff* came as fast… as we…*urp*… could…”

“Sorry for… being late, Father. Abe here, wanted to… finish up… his meal… would have… eaten… also the… table… if you hadn’t… told us… to come…”

“Ah, nothing to worry about, my Brothers. It is good that you want to enjoy your carnal desires. Still, your ascensions await… As I taught you…”

“We shall… push… into the… pit… of…*urp*… humid… darkness, travel… through the…*oaarp*… tunnel of… constrictive… pain and reach… the…*huff* lake… of burning… pain. By bathing… in those… waters, we shall… be reborn…”

“We shall push… into the pit… of humid… darkness, travel through… the tunnel… of constrictive pain… and reach the lake… of burning pain. By bathing in… those waters, we… shall be reborn…”

As the two last members of the crew chanted each in his own fashion, the sacred prayer that Father Driscoll had taught them, both began following Jack as they climbed on top of Ann’s body. Huffing and puffing, the two massive blobs of men, made it finally on the top of their ‘Goddess’ which was looking at them with a strange expression on her face.

“J-Jack? Who are these guys? What’s happening?”

“My, sweet, sweet, little Ann…Didn’t you want to know what those delicious treats were? The ones I’ve been feeding you in the last few weeks?”

“Y-Yes…”

“Why, I see, that there is a bit of drool escaping your lips…You still need me to tell you, what I’ve been giving you? You still need to hear it? Or do you know it already?
If is fear that grips your mind, let it all wash away.

Brother Abe and Joshua, here, they wish nothing more than plunge deep into you… It’s their wish, isn’t it, brothers?”

Abe, bowing his head a little, was the first of the two to speak up.

“Yes, Mistress… We desire…nothing else…than be…welcomed…within you…will you…refuse us?”

“As my brother said, we would be…so grateful, should you…accept us…within yourself…aren’t we…faithful enough?”

Ann, since a long time already had been slightly aware of what Jack was giving her. She had thought about it, as she digested each and every new treat, as to what could be just as large and could be just as filling as what she had been eating, considering that she was on a ship. She hadn’t wanted to admit it with herself but, she had thought about that.

And the worst, in her eyes, was that she couldn’t stop herself. Ann didn’t know what it was that made people so good but, they were. And the fatter they got, the better they tasted. As she grew addicted to the taste, so the desire to have more grew within her. As smaller became the voice of reason in her, which was nowadays a barely audible whisper.

And now, as she was presented with another two succulents, delicious, morsels she just couldn’t stop herself. As much as she loved and hated it, she couldn’t refuse Jack’s offer. If those two really wanted to be inside of her, how could she say no to them?

And yet, a tiny whisper in her head, tried to make itself heard.
‘But if you eat these two, knowingly, what will stop you from taking others as long as YOU believe that they’re doing it willingly?’

But the voice was lost in the cacophonic mess that was her mind, driven wild by the appetizing look of those new treats walking toward her by their own decision. Ann, after, said to herself that she didn’t do anything. She just stood there with her slavering mouth open. It was those two that walked and crouched, and squirmed and crawled in her mouth, forcing themselves upon her throat, launching themselves to their doom deep into her gullet, falling rapidly into the pit of her stomach, where her stomach acids began rapidly to digest them.

She didn’t do anything and yet, as she licked her lips, feeling new pounds expanding her already massive body, she had on her face a smug smile, feeling for the first time in so long, finally full.

As Ann laid there, silently digesting, Jack moved swiftly beside her head, caressing her hairs, as he whispered softly into her ear.

“Don’t you see it, Ann? Why go back to making movies when you can turn work into an enjoyable experience? We could work for the government, clearing out the overworked prison system, or make our own enterprise, working to help others get rid of troublemakers.

With your beauty, your appetite and my brain, we can do all we want…and we will be able to sate you, my beautiful, amazing, eating machine…”
